titles.title: A bill to permit Women's Business Centers to re-compete for sustainability grants.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

bill.summary: 7/27/2005--Passed Senate without amendment. Amends provisions of the Small Business Act relating to the women's business center program (a program of Small Business Administration (SBA) grants to establish centers to aid women-owned small businesses) to make any grant recipient whose five-year project ended in FY2004 eligible to apply for a grant to continue such a center in sustainability status for FY2005.
